pageContext.claim: “What kind of an FBI -- they break down doors for Paul Manafort early in the morning. His wife is in bed like at five or six in the morning.”
pageContext.analysis: In a court filing, the special prosecutor wrote: "The warrant application had not sought permission to enter without knocking. In issuing the warrant, the magistrate judge authorized the government to execute the warrant any day through August 8, 2017, and to conduct the search 'in the daytime [from] 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.' The government complied fully with those date and time conditions."
